intro: Glossopetalon stipuliferum, commonly known as the Australian flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its striking, bright red or orange flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has compound leaves with stipules, which are small, leaf-like structures at the base of the leaf stalks. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental tree in gardens and parks. Glossopetalon stipuliferum is also valued for its ability to attract birds and insects due to its nectar-rich flowers.
